main event: A bright red light was observed traversing the sky over Hollywood, California on two successive nights, February 5 and 6, 1960.
interesting points: The light moved slowly and silently, remaining stationary for periods of 8 to 10 minutes at a time.
On the second night, there was an explosion and flash of light, followed by the formation of a 'mushroom-shaped' object.
After the explosion, a dull aluminum colored tubular shaped object was seen to shoot upwards, and a smaller object was seen 'spiraling' downwards.
The red light reappeared several seconds after the explosion, slightly higher in elevation.
Hundreds of witnesses in the Hollywood area observed the phenomenon over the two nights.
witnesses: hundreds of witnesses in the Hollywood area
photographs: no photographs were mentioned in the report
